QueryResults.Content:
Eudyptula (Little penguins)
      
      
      
         
            
            The Greek name Eudyptula means "good little diver" 
               
            
            
            
            Although some biologists consider the white-flippered little penguin as a seperate species, most of them see them as a subspecies
               of the little penguins. 
               
            
            
            
            The species is regarded as the most primitive penguin species on the evolutionary scale and reminds on ancestors like puffins
               and petrels. Comparable to Spheniscus species, they breed in holes (burrows) as a defence against the sun and predators.
               
            
            
            
            The group has a unique rhythm while they are nocturnal on land. They take a plunge early in the morning at sunrise and return
               not before sunset to feed and care for their chicks. Possible explanations: 
               
                
                  
                  to avoid the warmth of the day, while they are well protected against the cold water, but not so good against the sun.
                     
                  
                  
                  
                  absence of nocturnal land predators
                     
                  
                  
                  
                  at twilight their prey swims closer to the water surface, so they don't have to dive very deep before returning ashore at
                     sunset.
                     
                  
                  
                  
               
               
               
            
            
            
            While they mainly breed on the Australian and New Zealand mainland, they aren't very popular with everyone. They dig in flowerbeds,
               or make their burrow under (especially wooden) houses. During courtship, they keep awake the inhabitants (nocturnal on land)
               by their calls and fights. And while feeding their chicks, some fish remains will cause a foul smell. Also sick or dead birds
               under a house can give off a stench and inconvenience.
               
            
            
            
            The group belongs to the warm sea penguins, which means they live in moderate oceans. 
               
            
            
         
         
      
      
      
         
         
            
            Little penguin (Eudyptula minor)
               
            
            
         
         
         
         
            
            Parent topic: Types of penguins

Systematics and evolution
      
      
       
         
      
      
      
      
         
         
            
            Living species and recent extinctions
               
            
            
            Taxonomy
               
            
            
            Evolution
